question: who was the ottoman governor who led egypt in the years following the napoleonic wars
vanilla_rag_result: The passages provided do not contain information about the Ottoman governor who led Egypt in the years following the Napoleonic Wars. However, historically, after the Napoleonic Wars, Muhammad Ali Pasha is recognized as the Ottoman governor who effectively ruled Egypt from 1805 to 1848. He is often regarded as the founder of modern Egypt due to his extensive reforms in various sectors.
